# Methods links

## Download R:
 [CRAN website](https://cran.r-project.org/)  
 
## Download RStudio:   
 [Rstudio main site](https://www.rstudio.com/)     
 [R projects (useful feature of RStudio)](https://support.rstudio.com/hc/en-us/articles/200526207-Using-Projects)        
 [Rstudio online learning resources](https://www.rstudio.com/online-learning/)      
 
## R Introductory Tutorials and Courses
 [Swirl Stats- learn R in R](https://swirlstats.com/)
 [Datacamp's- "Intro to R"](https://www.datacamp.com/home)   
 [Prelude in R](https://preludeinr.com)      
 [R for beginners](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/Paradis-rdebuts_en.pdf)   
 [Hadley Wickhams "R for Data Science"](http://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html)
 [Modern Dive](https://ismayc.github.io/moderndiver-book/)     
 [Data carpentry course](http://www.datacarpentry.org/semester-biology/)
 [Many other resources](https://cran.r-project.org/other-docs.html) 
 [Many R Books (and other useful resources)](http://rbasicsworkshop.weebly.com/books.html)    
 [Base R tutorial- oldie but goodie](https://gsp.humboldt.edu/olm/R/Tutorials/BestFirstRTutorial.pdf)

## R Examples (some people learn best by just playing with existing code!)            
 [R by example](http://www.mayin.org/ajayshah/KB/R/)      

## R reference cards (print 'em out and hang by your office desk!)       
 [Base R Cheat sheet](https://iqss.github.io/dss-workshops/R/Rintro/base-r-cheat-sheet.pdf)              
 [Short Reference Card](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/Short-refcard.pdf)  
 [More comprehensive reference card](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/Baggott-refcard-v2.pdf) 
 [More advanced base R cheat sheet](https://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/advancedR.pdf)   
 [RStudio cheatsheets- very useful!](https://www.rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/)     
     Includes cheatsheets for R markdown, shiny, data wrangling with "dplyr" and much more!     

## R Markdown (for publishing and communicating in R. This website was built in R Markdown!)          
 [Guide for Pandoc Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/authoring_pandoc_markdown.html)   
 [Website development for RMarkdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/rmarkdown_websites.html)   
 [YAML: YAML Ain't Markup Language!](http://yaml.org/)   
 [a nice simple Markdown syntax guide](https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/markdown-syntax-guide-776639995.html)  

## GIT (for sharing your code and collaborating with others!)        
 [Excellent intro GIT tutorial](https://try.github.io/)

 [Bayesian Methods for Hackers!](http://camdavidsonpilon.github.io/Probabilistic-Programming-and-Bayesian-Methods-for-Hackers/)    
 [NIMBLE (alternative implementation of BUGS language for R)](https://r-nimble.org/)
